samples.questionContent:
Three trucks start at rest, side-by-side. The trucks carry different mass loads. The three drivers press their accelerators at the same time, and the trucks experience equal strength net forces. The positions of the three trucks before starting and a short time later are modeled below.

samples.problemType: Order parts by level of complexity
samples.questionContent:
The parts of the body listed below are involved in breaking down and absorbing nutrients from food.

**Order the parts from least to most complex.** 

**Least complex**

[[☃ sorter 1]]

**Most complex**

A model of the electromagnetic spectrum is shown below.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Rank the following electromagnetic waves from highest frequency to lowest frequency.**

*highest frequency*

[[☃ sorter 1]]

*lowest frequency*

**Order the stages of human development from earliest to latest.**

*Note: The stages are not shown to scale.*

**Earliest**

[[☃ sorter 1]]

**Latest**

[[☃ explanation 1]]

correct: ![A zygote, shown as a single cell with a nucleus enclosed in a circular capsule.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-content-images/2f8a465668dc21f22532aaa77eeac6081e3a2bb3.png)

![A blastocyst, shown as a hollow ring of cells inside a circular capsule with a clump of cells towards the top of the ring.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-content-images/b0e254954ce69e183371c780681627e147092f1a.png)
![A human embryo, showing an elongated and slightly curved form with a distinguishable head and body.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-content-images/172474a26b0ee92fe9bdd99863e2ab70d5419bb5.png)
![A human fetus, showing a distinct head, torso, arms, legs, and umbilical cord.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-content-images/46994fcf67a653c9c946b41c4463b5a44c2d1d10.png)

samples.problemType: Order of events in M phase
samples.questionContent:
**Drag the tiles to place the events of the mitotic $(\text{M})$ phase in order from first to last.**

*First event*

[[☃ sorter 1]]

*Last event*

correct: Chromosomes condense and the nuclear envelope breaks down.
The mitotic spindle helps chromosomes line up along the metaphase plate.
Sister chromatids separate into individual chromosomes, which then move to opposite ends of the cell.
The mitotic spindle breaks down and nuclear envelopes form.
The cell’s cytoplasm is split, forming two new cells.

samples.questionContent:

*Answer $2$ questions about the data set.*

1. **Sort the data from least to greatest.**

2. **Find the interquartile range (IQR) of the data set.**
